message.content:
{"id": "12398", 
"title": "Bug 12398: Accessibility problems", 
"description": "When I launch the Help view, I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas (e.g. the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame) before it starts working. The tab key does not actually do anything. This causes accessibility issues. ", 
"OB": "The Help view should be starting in a way that can be immediately navigated via the keyboard. Currently, it requires the user to first click on a 'live' area for it to work.", 
"EB": "The Help view should automatically be navigable via the keyboard upon launching. Users should not have to click on any specific area to make it work.", 
"SR": "20020326, Win2K"}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12398', 'title': 'Bug 12398Accessibility problems', 'description': 'Bug 12398Accessibility problems I needto first click on one of the "live" areas before it starts working (eg. thebanner with the tool buttons, the nav frame or the content frame. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'We should bestarting the Help view in a way that can be immediately navigated via thekeyboard. ', 'SR': '20020326, Win2KWhen I launch the Help view, the tab key does not actually do anything. '}
